simplegui

Class SimpleGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • simplegui.SimpleGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener

    public class SimpleGUI
extends java.lang.Thread
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(DrwImage image,
             double x,
             double y,
             double width,
             double height,
             java.lang.String name)
        Draw image. Width and height can be specified. Setting width(height) to -1 adjusts the width(height) to the panel, setting width(height) to 0, uses the image's original width(height).
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        width -
        height -
        name -

      • repaintPanel

        public void repaintPanel()
        Repaint the panel. Explicit repaint. By default, all drawing methods do a repaint. This can be switched off (for animation, anti flickering), and be replaced by an explicit repaint call. See also: setAutoRepaint()

      • setAutoRepaint

        public void setAutoRepaint(boolean repaintOn)
        By default, all drawing methods perform an immediate repaint. This behavior can be controlled here. See also: repaintPanel().
        Parameters:
        repaintOn -

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color c)
        Set background color
        Parameters:
        c - background color

      • setColorAndTransparency

        public void setColorAndTransparency(java.awt.Color c,
                           double transparency)
        set default values for color and transparency. draw commands, which do not specify color/transparency, will use these values. Changing the default values will only affect newly created drawables.
        Parameters:
        c -
        transparency -

      • eraseSingleDrawable

        public boolean eraseSingleDrawable(java.lang.String name)
        Remove specific drawable from panel. Removes first drawable with given name.
        Parameters:
        name - name of drawable to erase. Names can be specified in draw commands.
        Returns:
        returns true if a drawable was removed.

      • eraseAllDrawables

        public void eraseAllDrawables(java.lang.String name)
        Remove all specified drawables from panel. In contrast to eraseSingleDrawable this method removes all drawables with a given name. This can be used to remove groups of drawables.
        Parameters:
        name - name of drawable to erase. Names can be specified in draw commands.

      • eraseAllDrawables

        public void eraseAllDrawables()
        Clear panel, remove all drawables.

      • getSliderValue

        public int getSliderValue()
        Get slider value without registering (synchronous).
        Returns:
        slider value (between 0 and 100)

      • getSwitchValue

        public boolean getSwitchValue()
        retrieve radio button value without registering, switched on (true)/off(false), synchronous version
        Returns:
        radio button switch-state

      • waitForButton1

        public void waitForButton1()
        Synchronous query of button1. Waits until button is pressed. It's not advisable to use buttons this way. Better use event based methods.

      • waitForButton2

        public void waitForButton2()
        Synchronous query of button2. Waits until button is pressed. It's not advisable to use buttons this way. Better use event based methods.

        register to this SimpleGUI. Registered listeners will be called on actions from button1, button2, switch, slider.
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • timerPause

        public void timerPause()
        Pause Timer. To restart, use timerStart();

      • registerToTimer

        public void registerToTimer(TimerListener t)
        Register a TimerListener to the timer. To remove from timer, use removeFromTimer(t)
        Parameters:
        t - the listener

      • removeFromTimer

        public void removeFromTimer(TimerListener t)
        Cancel a registration to timer. Removes Listener from timer-list.
        Parameters:
        t - the listener to be removed

      • keyReadString

        public java.lang.String keyReadString(boolean eraseText)
        wait until is pressed, return all input. This is a non-event based keyboard routine! It is advised to use event based key-input!
        Returns:
        string

      • keyReadString

        public java.lang.String keyReadString()

      • keyReadChar

        public char keyReadChar(boolean eraseText)
        wait until a single key is pressed, return all input. This is a non-event based keyboard routine! It is advised to use event based key-input!
        Returns:
        char

      • keyReadChar

        public char keyReadChar()

      • keyReadDouble

        public double keyReadDouble(boolean eraseText)
        wait for double-format number input. Invalid format input is caught, the user is prompted to re-enter. This is a non-event based keyboard routine! It is advised to use event based key-input!
        Returns:
        char

      • keyReadDouble

        public double keyReadDouble()

      • registerToKeyboard

        public void registerToKeyboard(KeyboardListener kl)
        register a KeyboardListener to SimpleGUI object.
        Parameters:
        kl -

      • waitForMouseClick

        public int[] waitForMouseClick()
        wait for mouse click. Sequential version. It is advised to use the event based version! This version has a wait loop, causing a delay of 100ms
        Returns:
        int [] x,y of mouse position in draw panel

      • registerToMouse

        public void registerToMouse(SGMouseListener l)
        register to mouse
        Parameters:
        l -
